name: Ibis Styles Troyes Centre

reviews.text: We stopped here on way back from Alps, following recommendations on this site. The hotel is seemingly brand new, and in a commercial centre with other hotels and cinema and restaurants 10 mins away from the centre of Troyes. This was on balance our favourite of the stopover hotels we tried - everything worked well. Its minimally staffed, but this is fine and presumably keeps costs down. The room was huge and very pleasant, without a bath which was a shame, and also the fridge/microwave of the Suite Novotels would have been welcome, I am not sure why All Seasons does not follow the same policy. But the convenience and relaxedness of the common area, with free tea/coffee and cakes until 10, computers for the kids to hang out in, made up for these. No restaurant, but no need as there are 3 or 4 nice ones just next door (having kids, we ate at Hippopomus, which was not cheap for what it was but was good for the kids) Best of all, Troyes was fabulous to explore for a day, with beautiful old buildings - and after the Alps it was refreshing not to be greeted in English as soon as we opened our mouths!
reviews.title: lovely city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here overnight en route to the south. Having been refurbished the previous year, the hotel was immaculate; very modern decoration in bright colours, especially lime green! Our room was enormous & the wet room as big as some hotels rooms I've stayed in! No restaurant but there are a number within easy walking distance: we used the "Hippopotamus" grill, about 2mins. walk. Breakfast was the usual continental type with plenty of choice. No tea/coffee facilities in the room (fortunately we had our own) but this is available for free in the hospitality area near reception. The staff were very polite, most helpful & spoke English. The hotel has an underground car park (fee payable) but arriving mid-afternoon, we easily found a space just past the hotel towards the Ibis 100 yards further on. We had booked over 21 days ahead so were able to get a discount that included breakfast & wifi. For a budget hotel, we were highly impressed and would definitely stay here again & for longer so we could then explore the very pretty medieval town.
reviews.title: Really lovely hotel

reviews.text: Good location, short walk from centre of old town, plenty of restaurants there, even better walking around in daylight! Troyes is a nice place to visit, with planty to see & do. Hotel staff helpful and parking nearby, underground 9 euros a night though, but secure.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Ibis on the way down through France and in the All Seasons on the way back up. If you have breakfast at the Ibis, it costs you extra. Where as at the All Seasons's it's included in the price. So the price difference only works out to be ~£15 which is well worth it as the All Seasons is higher quality everything. Tiled bathroom, better bed's Gym, Wifi included, etc. I couldn't fault it, the staff were courteous and friendly, everything was clean tidy and worked well. I'd definitely go there again over the Ibis which I also thought was good.
reviews.title: Better value that Ibis next door

description: The Ibis Troyes Centre hotel is located in the city's historic centre, close to the Town Hall, numerous restaurants and a cinema multiplex. 5 km from the airport, the hotel has 77 air-conditioned rooms, including 3 adapted for disabled guests, a bar serving snacks 24/24 and private covered pay parking. For your conferences and seminars, you can book 2 meeting rooms. Wifi wireless Internet access for guests on a business trip.
